page.title: 11Demperston Farm
page.content: The farm's original name was{ {Deemster Toun.}It was named after the local judge,or Deemster who lived there. It has{520 acres}of medium to heavy loam (fine soil containing silt which dries hard in hot weather). Four people work on the farm, which may not seem like a lot, but is more than most farmers employ. There are{60 {-70 commercial beef breeding cows,}and {1 pedigree Simmental bull.}The farmer lets some land to sheep graziers. The animals are fed on{grass, {rolled barley, hay, mineral {supplement, molassed sugar-beet pulp {and soya meal.} The farmer grows{peas}for animal feed,{potatoes, turnips, grass}and{ {barley}(the largest crop) for animal feed and malting.He uses a wide range of equipment.
